CatDescriptText: Mr. Carroll Davis, construction worker, Hill District and Mr. Kenny Fisher, musician, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 2, 1961, pg. 7, with question: " Do you think police could wipe out all the rackets if they launched an intense, earnest campaign against vice and crime?"  Mr. Davis' answer reads: "No.  It's been going on ever since time began - unless they could eliminate some of the politicians involved."  Mrs. Fisher's answer reads: "With constant effort to this end.  I think it would be possible."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Carroll Davis wearing light colored t-shirt and cap, standing in front of building with sign for Tom Tucker soda; Portrait of Kenny Fisher wearing plaid shirt, standing in front of automobiles and buildings
